Class Core

java.lang.Object
SystemEnvironment.Core
public class Core extends Object
Represents a single processing core in the simulator.

This core maintains its local scheduler, task set, ready queue and a queue of runtime costs (context switch and migration). It cooperates with the parent Processor and CoreSet to:

  • accept jobs and (for non-global scheduling) immediately re-calculate dynamic priorities to avoid SRP inheritance issues;
  • choose the next job to execute considering preemption and whether a context switch or migration cost is required;
  • record execution/idle/wait/context-switch/migration intervals into SchedulingInfo with power usage;
  • invoke controller and DVS hooks on first execute, preemption, completion and periodic checks.

Inline comments about global scheduling, blocking/waiting behavior, SRP-related ordering, and end-of-interval cost cleanup have been integrated.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    boolean
    isChangeLock
    Flag set when a job enters or exits a critical section (lock use changes), forcing an immediate scheduling record to reflect lock usage transitions.
    boolean
    isChangeSpeed
    Flag set when the speed changes so that the next recording reflects the new speed even if other state does not change.
    boolean
    isPreemption
    Indicates whether this core allows preemption so that a newly arrived higher-priority job can preempt the current job without delay.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Core()
    Constructs a new core with empty task/ready queues, an initialized local scheduler, IDLE status, zeroed time and power counters, and preemption enabled.

  • Field Details

    • isPreemption

      public boolean isPreemption
      Indicates whether this core allows preemption so that a newly arrived higher-priority job can preempt the current job without delay.

    • isChangeLock

      public boolean isChangeLock
      Flag set when a job enters or exits a critical section (lock use changes), forcing an immediate scheduling record to reflect lock usage transitions.

    • isChangeSpeed

      public boolean isChangeSpeed
      Flag set when the speed changes so that the next recording reflects the new speed even if other state does not change.

  • Constructor Details

    • Core

      public Core()
      Constructs a new core with empty task/ready queues, an initialized local scheduler, IDLE status, zeroed time and power counters, and preemption enabled. Recording change flags are reset.

  • Method Details

    • addTask

      public void addTask(Task t)
      Adds a task to this core and sets the task's local core reference.
      Parameters:
      t - the task to add to this core

    • schedulerCalculatePriorityForFixed

      public void schedulerCalculatePriorityForFixed()
      Calculates and assigns fixed priorities for all tasks in this core using the local scheduler (prints results for debugging).

    • JobToCore

      public void JobToCore(Job j)
      Accepts an arriving job into this core.

      Integrates DVS checks and handles Global vs. single/partition scheduling:

      • Global: keeps the local ready queue consistent and sets current core;
      • Non-global: initializes origin/current core and immediately recomputes dynamic priorities to avoid SRP inheritance issues.
      Parameters:
      j - the arriving job

    • chooseExecuteJob

      public void chooseExecuteJob()
      Chooses which job to execute next and, when needed, inserts context switch costs or performs a direct switch. Handles:
      • dynamic priority recalculation for non-global scheduling;
      • preemption decisions (new job vs. current);
      • context switch when resuming a previously COMPUTING job;
      • IDLE transitions when the queue is empty.

    • readyRun

      public void readyRun()
      Prepares the core to run the current working job.

      Loops while the core is not ready and no runtime cost is in progress: performs controller/DVS first-execute checks, handles WAIT vs. non-WAIT states, and for Global scheduling may return jobs to the global queue and fetch a new one. A potential infinite loop indicates missing PIP or suspension usage at the time of blocking (per inline notes).

    • checkCost

      public void checkCost()
      If there is a pending runtime cost in the queue, updates this core's status to match the front cost (context switch or migration).

    • run

      public void run(long processedTime)
      Advances the simulation on this core by the specified time slice.

      Records a scheduling point, updates current time and power, and executes the appropriate action based on current status: EXECUTION, IDLE, WAIT (records waiting time), CONTEXTSWITCH or MIGRATION (delegates to the cost at the head of the queue).

      Parameters:
      processedTime - the time slice to process

    • checkJobisCompleted

      public void checkJobisCompleted()
      Checks whether the current working job has completed its target amount. If completed (and not already marked), sets status to COMPLETED, triggers controller/DVS actions, and removes the job from both the local and current-core ready queues to handle migration scenarios.

    • lastCheckCost

      public void lastCheckCost()
      At the end of the current execution interval, checks pending costs and removes or re-queues them based on whether the request job has completed or missed its deadline. Updates the core status accordingly.

    • finalRecording

      public void finalRecording()
      Finalizes scheduling records by writing the accumulated total power consumption into the last SchedulingInfo.

    • record

      public void record()
      Records a scheduling point if needed and creates a new SchedulingInfo when:
      • status changes (E/I/W/C/M),
      • the job associated with the state changes,
      • lock usage changes (isChangeLock), or
      • speed changes (isChangeSpeed).

      Only records within the simulation time window, unless a speed change forces recording. Integrated inline logging is preserved.

    • setWorkingJob

      public void setWorkingJob(Job j)
      Sets the currently working job on this core. If there is an existing COMPUTING job, this indicates a preemption and triggers the controller preemption action.
      Parameters:
      j - the job to run (or null to leave the core idle)

    • setID

      public void setID(int id)
      Sets the core identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - the core id

    • setParentCoreSet

      public void setParentCoreSet(CoreSet coreSet)
      Sets the parent core set to which this core belongs.
      Parameters:
      coreSet - the parent CoreSet

    • setParentProcessor

      public void setParentProcessor(Processor p)
      Sets the parent processor that owns this core.
      Parameters:
      p - the parent Processor

    • setLocalSchedAlgorithm

      public void setLocalSchedAlgorithm(PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm a)
      Installs a local priority-driven scheduling algorithm for this core.
      Parameters:
      a - the scheduling algorithm to use

    • setTaskSet

      public void setTaskSet(TaskSet ts)
      Replaces the task set used by this core.
      Parameters:
      ts - the new TaskSet

    • setLocalReadyQueue

      public void setLocalReadyQueue(JobQueue jq)
      Sets the local ready queue for this core.
      Parameters:
      jq - the JobQueue to use as the local ready queue

    • setCurrentSpeed

      public void setCurrentSpeed(double s)
      Sets the current processing speed value cached on this core. Note: effective execution uses the speed from the parent CoreSet.
      Parameters:
      s - the speed value

    • setCoreStatus

      public void setCoreStatus(Definition.CoreStatus c)
      Updates the core status (IDLE, EXECUTION, WAIT, CONTEXTSWITCH, MIGRATION, STOP).
      Parameters:
      c - the new Definition.CoreStatus

    • setContextSwitchCost

      public void setContextSwitchCost(Core requestCore, Job requestJob)
      Inserts a context switch cost for the given request job if the simulator configures a non-zero context switch time; otherwise directly switches the working job. Also increments the context-switch counter.
      Parameters:
      requestCore - the core that requests the switch
      requestJob - the job causing the context switch

    • setMigrationCost

      public void setMigrationCost(Core requestCore, Job requestJob)
      Inserts migration (and preceding context switch) costs for a migrating job.

      Behavior:

      • If context-switch time > 0, add a context-switch cost first;
      • If migration time > 0, add a migration cost;
      • Link the two so migration follows the context switch;
      • If both costs are zero and the request core is this core, requeue the job locally and set its current core.

      Inline note: costs are produced only when the origin core is in a state that allows starting migration (no pending costs).

      Parameters:
      requestCore - the core where the request originates
      requestJob - the job to migrate

    • setbeBlockedTimeOfJobByLocalQueue

      public void setbeBlockedTimeOfJobByLocalQueue()
      Accounts for blocking time of the current job in the local ready queue when the core is in EXECUTION or WAIT state.

    • getID

      public int getID()
      Returns this core's identifier.
      Returns:
      the core id

      Returns the parent core set.

      Returns:
      the parent Processor

      public Scheduler getLocalScheduler()
      Returns the local scheduler instance.
      Returns:
      the Scheduler used by this core

    • getLocalReadyQueue

      public JobQueue getLocalReadyQueue()
      Returns the local ready queue.
      Returns:
      the local JobQueue

    • getWorkingJob

      public Job getWorkingJob()
      Returns the currently working job, or null if none.
      Returns:
      the current working job or null

    • getTaskSet

      public TaskSet getTaskSet()
      Returns the task set assigned to this core.
      Returns:
      the TaskSet

    • getStatus

      public Definition.CoreStatus getStatus()
      Returns the current core status.
      Returns:
      the Definition.CoreStatus

    • getTask

      public Task getTask(int i)
      Returns the task at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      i - the index within the task set
      Returns:
      the Task at the given index

    • getSchedulingInfoSet

      public Vector<SchedulingInfo> getSchedulingInfoSet()
      Returns the list of scheduling records produced by this core.
      Returns:
      a vector of SchedulingInfo

    • getCurrentSpeed

      public double getCurrentSpeed()
      Returns the cached current speed of this core. Note: execution uses the speed from CoreSet.
      Returns:
      the current speed value

    • getCurrentTime

      public long getCurrentTime()
      Returns the current simulated time on this core.
      Returns:
      the current time

    • getPowerConsumption

      public long getPowerConsumption()
      Returns the accumulated power consumption.
      Returns:
      the total power consumption

    • getContextSwitchCount

      public int getContextSwitchCount()
      Returns the number of context switches counted for this core.
      Returns:
      context switch count

    • getMigrationCount

      public long getMigrationCount()
      Returns the number of migrations counted for this core.
      Returns:
      migration count

    • getCostQueue

      public Queue<Cost> getCostQueue()
      Returns the pending runtime cost queue (context switch/migration).
      Returns:
      the cost queue
